title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
I have a 820-2915-a (2011 MacBook Pro 15) that was running a memtest86 when it spontaneously shutdown. It will not start up again. The power connector stays green, even though the battery is at ~10% charge. 
SMC reset does not work. 
SMC bypass does not work.
Left battery disconnected overnight, then plugged in power cable: no fan spin.
Plugged in after disconnected all peripherals from logic board except fans: no fan spin.
No water damage.
Logic board was replaced by Apple maybe... 4 years back? For GPU failure.

Probed the following:
PPDCIN_G3H - 16.7V
PPBUS_G3H - 12.5V
PP3V42_G3H - 3.48V
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.4V
PP5V_S5 - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-5V ~2Hz
PP5V_SUS - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-5V
PP3V3_S5 - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-3.5V
PP3V3_ENET - 0V
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC - 3.3V
PP3V3_S5_SMC_AVCC - 3.5V
PP3V3_S5_EN - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-3.5V
SMC_PM_G2_EN - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-3.5V
S5_PWRGD - [B]pulsing[/B] 0-3.4V
SMC_RESET_L - 3.4V
SMC_ADAPTER - [B]pulsing[/B] 0 - 3.46V
PM_SLP_S5_L - 0V
G3_POWERON_L - 0V

My best guess is SMC or TPS51980? Any ideas if I am on the right track / have the right issue nailed down? I don't want to blindly jump into replacing the SMC if I don't have to... it looks like a pain.

Thanks.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Be sure to use original 85W charger.
Battery should charge even in off state.
If Magsafe stuck in green light, there may be a problem with SMC, or battery.

Check diode mode to ground on all big coils; starting with L7220/60.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Thanks!

I am using the original charger that came with the laptop (its a new one that apple replaced cause my old one frayed).

The battery was replaced at the same time as the motherboard so it is relatively new; also I don't have that many cycles on it (maybe 100?) It does not charge at all. I left it plugged in for about 2 hours and the MagSafe stayed green the whole time and the battery indicator light did not change.

I will check the coils.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Please write directly on the Reply Box.
I don't see a real reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Disconnect BIL and see if starts charging.

SDA - 0.522V (diode) 4.473V (volt)

Disconnecting battery indicator light seems to have no effect, still not charging (MagSafe stays green).

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
"L7220 - 0.001 V"
There is a short circuit.
Left the coil one side and check where the short remains.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Not sure what you mean by left the coil one side.

edit: do you mean desolder one side?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Sorry for misstyping; yes, I meant LIFT...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Removed the coil. Diode readings:
Pad 1 - 0.001V
Pad 2 - 0.483V

Removed caps 7252 and 7250. Both 0.001V diode readings.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Pure short to ground on 5V_S3 power rail.
Voltage injection method will help you to find the culprit.
Read more on the forum, before applying voltage.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Tracked down the short to C4690. Replaced cap and no more evaporating alcohol / current draw. However, there is still no fan spin. PP5V_S3 still pulses up and down.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: 3V3_S5 is stable now?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Negative. 3V3_S5 still pulsing.

Turns on with both charger and battery connected?
Is the battery charging now?

message: Did you check the coils at same time when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L???

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Read "HOW TO collection" thread please...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: The pulsing inductors measured above continue pulsing when I ground the SMC_ONOFF. However, the pulsing frequency approximately doubles while SMC_ONOFF is grounded, and afterwards when I disconnect the SMC_ONOFF, it goes back to its previous frequency.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Don't ground SMC_ONOFF_L, trigger it; like when pressing power button, less than 1s.
Use R5015/16 pads, instead of power button; when work with the board alone on the desk.
You must check signals and voltages reaction at the same moment.

In fact, solder an wire on SMC_ONOFF_L and touch any metal plate, simulating power button.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Understood. Please see the attached images for what I mean by grounding. The blue line is the scope of the "trigger". The pulsing is still there.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: When using o-scope, check for DC pulse at output pin of the coil; where the filter cap is connected.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: The plots were taken with probe on pin 2 of inductors L7260 and L7770.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Very strange pulses.
If you hold down (to ground) SMC_ONOFF_L for 5s, still get pulse on these coils?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: yep still pulses, as shown in attached images

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Keep SMC_ONOFF_L down more time, it should turn off the board.
Only 3V3_S5 must remain present after and no pulse on other coils.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
I do love the way that you say 'Read HOW TO collection'

Do you know that new members such as me have no idea where that section is,. Cannot see it, cannot search for ''how to' as that brings up an error. 

Hiw about you simply paste in the link to help new mebers?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Not sure what happened but the behavior changed. So this is the process:

Power cycle
L7260_1_1
Disconnect SMC_ONOFF_L
L7260_1_2
Power cycle
L7260_2

So it looks like the behavior changed after the first long press of SMC_ONOFF_L. Now it seems like grounding SMC_ONOFF_L causes the PP3V3_S5 to go to 2.5V as opposed to pulsing. Then after grounding is removed, the voltage stays constant at 0.5V. The pulsing does not return until the board is power cycled again.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Not sure what happened but the behavior changed. So this is the process:

Power cycle
L7260_1_1
Disconnect SMC_ONOFF_L
L7260_1_2
Power cycle
L7260_2

So it looks like the behavior changed after the first long press of SMC_ONOFF_L. Now it seems like grounding SMC_ONOFF_L causes the PP3V3_S5 to go to 2.5V as opposed to pulsing. Then after grounding is removed, the voltage stays constant at 0.5V. The pulsing does not return until the board is power cycled again.

After power cycling, the pulsing starts again. During that time, the other coils that show pulsing (L7770 for example) continue to pulse. However, after the pulsing stops (after holding SMC_ONOFF_L for more than 1 second, as stated above), those lines go to 0V.

Also, not shown here, after power cycle, and while it is pulsing, when I do a short "press" of SMC_ONOFF_L, grounding for maybe 1 second? the voltage jumps to ~2.4, and then when ungrounded it stays at 0.5V. However, if I just "tap" SMC_ONOFF_L, grounding maybe 0.1seconds?, the voltage jumps to ~2.4, but when ungrounded goes back to pulsing.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Once Magsafe is connected, 3V3_S5 must get stable (C7290), no matters board is on or off.
Confirm your actual case.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: it is stable at 3.3V

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: voltage pulses at C7290, same as L7260, once MagSafe is connected. once SMC_ONOFF_L is grounded for 1-2 seconds and then ungrounded, it stays stable at 0.75V, the same as L7260 from above.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
I think in early post you've said to have steady 3V3_S5 voltage.
Check now PPBUS_G3H, 3V42_G3H, SMC RESET_L and SMC_PM_G2_EN.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
PPBUS_G3H -12.48V
3V42_G3H - 3.48V
SMC_RESET_L - 3.48

SMC_PM_G2_EN:
[LIST]
[*]after MagSafe connection: pulsing 0 - 3.5V
[*]after holding SMC_ONOFF_L for 3s: stable at 3.5V
[/LIST]
All behavior above, with the exception of SMC_PM_G2_EN after holding SMC_ONOFF_L, is the exact same as it was initially.

PP3V3_S5 has never been stable at 3.3V. Once MagSafe is connected it pulses from 0 - 3.5V. The only time it is stable is after the SMC_ONOFF_L long hold to ground, after which it settles at 0.75V.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
You cannot get 3V3_S5 untill SMC_PM_G2_EN is stable.
Remove R7940 and run a wire from 3V42_G3H to C7942.
Check if 3V3_S5 gets steady voltage then.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
removed R7940, soldered a wire from pin 2 of where R7940 used to be (PP3V3_S5_EN) and also happens to be pin 1 of C7942, to pin 1 of R7941 (PP3V42_G3H).

PP3V3_S5 at C9487 pulsing 0 - 3.5V as usual.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Post basic voltages of U7201 now; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup

I asked about DC voltages!
PLEASE, hide the o-scope somewhere...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
I understand SMC_PM_G2_EN is still pulsing.
There should be a problem with SMC, or some of its sensors.

Check exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7000.
Remove F7040/41 and check the voltage at C7040.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
So PPBUS_G3H only fluctuates when F7040/41 are soldered in place?
Looks like SMC issue...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Wait hold on I feel like im missing something here. PPBUS_G3H never fluctuated at any point. Even in the beginning before removing any components, PPBUS_G3H was stable at 12.5V (post #1).

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
"Pin 23 - 12.25 - 12.75V ... weird interference, matches pulse frequency"
Dropping to 12.25V is sign of non working SMC, or communication problem between SMC and U7000.
Please clarify actual situation.
Only DC readings, forget the o-scope.
Trying to write down too much information, is not always helpful.
Sometime make us to lose the focus.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Ok so with the multimeter, which doesn't really update very quickly, it looks around 12.6V on Pin23, though the number moves around a little bit. This is similar to the DC voltage randomly jumping from 0V -> 2.3V -> 0.7V -> 0.2V -> etc etc for pulsing pins.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Fluctuating like 12.4-12.7V will not be a big problem.
But dropping to 12.25V is very bad.
However, you didn't mention such fluctuation at PPBUS_G3H.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Got it. So since it is in the 12.4 - 12.7V range, what is the next step?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Get steady SMC_PM_G2_EN...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: So based on what you said earlier about the U7000 and SMC, are you suggesting the next thing to do is to replace both components or something? The last concrete step was to remove the fuses.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Check if is possible to cut off trace for pin 12/U7201.
Then check if SMC_PM_G2_EN gets steady high.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: It seems like the trace goes under the chip. There is no trace leading out from pin 12 of the U7201.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
In an earlier post, you've said to get steady 3V at SMC_PM_G2_EN, if press SMC_ONOFF_L for 3s.
Is that still true?
If yes, check if 3V3_S5 gets steady at same time.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
I am super confused what is going on now because the pulsing frequency has now changed to what looks like 0.2Hz.

So what you stated is true, if I press SMC_ONOFF_L for about 1s (3s would be the same), SMC_PM_G2_EN gets solid 3.5V. 3V3_S5 gets solid 2.1V. 3V3_S5 doesn't look right only having 2.1V...

I have attached 3 images. SMC_ONOFF_L is the blue line in the images, while the yellow is the tested pin.

3V3_S5.png - data capture after a power cycle, and then pressing the SMC_ONOFF_L
SMC_PM_G2_EN.png - after a power cycle, and then pressing the SMC_ONOFF_L
3V3_S5_POWERCYCLE.png - 3V3_S5 immediately after MagSafe power cycle, no SMC_ONOFF_L triggering
SMC_PM_G2_EN_POWERCYCLE.png - SMC_PM_G2_EN immediately after MagSafe power cycle, no SMC_ONOFF_L triggering

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Please, let o-scope aside; do not complicate the job more than needed.

Post U7201 voltages, when you get steady SMC_PM_G2_EN; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.
If you don't get correct 3V3_S5 in that case, there's something wrong in U7201 area.
Inspect all surrounding resistors and traces; pay atention to R7260/61, R7263 and C7264.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
Note for all "cycling" pins the numbers are all approximate (value changes quickly so its whatever I could see at max).

12 - 3.48V
13 - .158V
21 - 3.48V
22 - 1.8 down to 1.7V then cycles 0.25Hz
23 - 1.9 down to 1.7V cycles 0.25Hz
29 - 1V cycles down to 0.8V 0.25Hz

P3V3S5_VFBR_R - spikes to 2V drops to 0V 0.25Hz
P3V3S5_VFBR - spikes 0.6V "  "
P3V3S5_DRVH - spikes 1.6V "  "
P3V3S5_TG - spikes 2V "  "

I don't see anything obviously wrong with components in this area.

message:
Remove R7978.
Check if symptom changes.

message: Did you ever get steady SMC_PM_G2_EN?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Yes. SMC_PM_G2_EN is steady at 3.48V as measured from pin 12 of U7201. Just to note, before and after R7978 removal, pin 12 was at 3.48V solid.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Then PPBUS_G3H is not stable at 12.5V?

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message: Nope it is solid right now at 1.5V. It did used to be around 12.5V with some fluctuations but since then we have removed a few components so not sure if that should be expected.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
OK, we start from scratch then.
Remove F7040/1 and check if get stable C7040 voltage.

SMC_PM_G2_EN should stay at 3V.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
F7040/1 were removed since post #40.

C7040 is solid 12.58V
SMC_PM_G2_EN solid 3.48V

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
"F7040/1 were removed since post #40."
Wait, you say that we lost so many days without PPBUS_G3H on the board???

I asked you to do that for test purpose only.
I never could imagine you didn't solder back the fuses...

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
So the changes I have noted so far are:

Post 34 - Remove R7940 and run a wire from 3V42_G3H to C7942
Post 40 - Remove F7040/41
Post 56 - Remove R7978

So what you are saying is undo all previous changes, except removing the fuses per post 64? None of the component removals / jumpering were reversed up to this point.

title: 820-2915-a Spontaneous Shutdown, No Startup
message:
We really have to start from zero...
Put back all components, in original configuration.
Then post again voltages and signals from power on sequence.

BTW, let the o-scope aside, we don't need it.
